question: 5 (a)
statement_html: Suppose \(\displaystyle a,b,m\) are integers with \(\displaystyle (a,m) = (b,m) = 1\). Let \(\displaystyle s = \text{ord}_{m}(a)\) and \(\displaystyle t = \text{ord}_{m}(b)\) and suppose that \(\displaystyle (s, t) = 1\) . Then show that \(\displaystyle \text{ord}_{m}(ab) = st\) .
statement_latex:
Suppose $\displaystyle a,b,m$ are integers with
$\displaystyle (a,m) = (b,m) = 1$. Let
$\displaystyle s = \text{ord}_{m}(a)$ and
$\displaystyle t = \text{ord}_{m}(b)$ and suppose that
$\displaystyle (s, t) = 1$ . Then show that
$\displaystyle \text{ord}_{m}(ab) = st$ .
statement_raw: Suppose <math> \displaystyle a,b,m</math> are integers with <math> \displaystyle (a,m) = (b,m) = 1 </math>. Let <math> \displaystyle s = \text{ord}_{m}(a)</math>  and <math> \displaystyle t = \text{ord}_{m}(b)</math>  and suppose that <math> \displaystyle (s, t) = 1</math> . Then show that <math> \displaystyle \text{ord}_{m}(ab) = st </math> .
